title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: can install development version RStudioBackupPrefs GitHub :
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs")  # Alternatively install.packages("librarian")  librarian::shelf("Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs")  # librarian::shelf() will install or load the package if already installed. # You can queue up multiple package in one line.

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: idea install package new R project machine, import preferences Github first cloning repository containing rstudio preference files copying relevant rstudio preference folder. backing , idea upload current RStudio settings currently git initiated repository, choose dedicated git repository RStudio settings.

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: Back using specific folder containing preference files. inside R project, ’d want specify path R folder outside current one (else ’s current one)
code: library(RStudioBackupPrefs) start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE) start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE, repository = "../MyRStudioPrefs")

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: case, function copy files rstudio preference folder (import), refresh F10.

previous_headings: Quick Start > Import preferences from Github
what: You have a new R project and want to import your preferences from Github
title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: required clone repository containing preferences first. convenience can clone github folder copy function. Use clone_git = TRUE, function ask git url can specify git url directly
code: start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE) start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE, git_url = "https://github.com/cran/dummies")

previous_headings: Quick Start > Import preferences from Github
what: You are in the R project containing your preference files, but you want to pull
title: RStudioBackupPrefs
code: start_import_prefs(pull_git = TRUE)

previous_headings: Quick Start > Import preferences from Github
what: Your files are already in your current project, specify your path
title: RStudioBackupPrefs
code: start_import_prefs("R/rstudio_preferences/")

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: Use start_import_prefs() import preferences local folder.
code: # Choose a path start_backup_prefs(preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences", copy_to_local = TRUE)   # If you are fine with leaving files in your R Studio preference folder start_backup_prefs()  # Use open_backup_path = TRUE to see your files in the explorer start_backup_prefs(open_backup_path = TRUE)

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: use GitHub functionalities, need initiated repository. Simply initiate one : Make sure put user.name user.email global config. , go Terminal write: Check Happy Git R information.
code: # Assuming you're in your desired folder path: usethis::use_git() usethis::use_github()  # Optional: usethis::git_vaccinate()  # Set your credentials if needed: gitcreds::gitcreds_set() git init git config --global user.name "YOUR FULL NAME" git config --global user.email "YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Minh-Anh Huynh. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Huynh M (2024). RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup RStudio preferences import GitHub. R package version 0.1.0,  https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/, https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup your RStudio preferences and import them on from GitHub},   author = {Minh-Anh Huynh},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0,  https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/},   url = {https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs}, }

what: RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup your RStudio preferences and import them on from GitHub — RStudioBackupPrefs-package
title: RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup your RStudio preferences and import them on from GitHub — RStudioBackupPrefs-package
text: package provides short functions automates backup import local github files.

what: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
text: Copy rstudio_bindings.json, addins.json rstudio-bindings.json r.snippets .bak R Studio config path.

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
code: backup_prefs(   open_backup_path = FALSE,   rstudio_pref_path = rstudio_config_path() )

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
text: open_backup_path logical: TRUE FALSE. Open preference folder end backing convenience. rstudio_pref_path string: Default rstudio config path.

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
text: Copy rstudio_bindings.json, addins.json rstudio-bindings.json r.snippets .bak R Studio config path.

title: Backup of R Studio preferences. — backup_prefs
code: backup_prefs(open_backup_path = FALSE)

what: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
text: Copy backup files chosen local folder

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
code: copy_files_to_local(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   rstudio_pref_path = rstudio_config_path() )

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
text: preference_path string: Use relative file path, add "/" end. rstudio_pref_path string: Default RStudio preference path.

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
text: Copy addins.json, r.snippets, rstudio_bindings.json, prefs.json folder working directory

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
code: temp_dir <- tempdir() copy_files_to_local(temp_dir) #> ✔ Preferences files copied to /tmp/Rtmp8aeI38 unlink(temp_dir)

what: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
text: Pull (clone) git repository contain backup preference files. function attempt pull current git repository default.

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
code: import_from_github(clone_git = FALSE, git_url = NULL)

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
text: clone_git boolean. Use option initiated repository. git_url string. Allow user bypass request git url directly clone desired git url repository

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
text: Clone pull GitHub link user prompt.

title: Import preferences from a GitHub url — import_from_github
code: if (FALSE) { # Pull changes from a GitHub repository import_from_github()  # Clone a repository from GitHub import_from_github(clone_git = TRUE) import_from_github(git_url = "https://github.com/cran/dummies") }

what: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
text: Import local preferences files R Studio

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
code: import_local_prefs(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   rstudio_pref_path = rstudio_config_path() )

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
text: preference_path string: Relative folder_path .json files contained. rstudio_pref_path string: Default rstudio_config_path.

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
text: Import addins.json, rstudio_bindings.json, r.snippets keybindings folder rstudio-prefs.json RStudio folder

title: Import local preferences files to R Studio — import_local_prefs
code: if (FALSE) { import_local_prefs("R/rstudio_preferences/") }

text: List online git repositories current user

code: list_github_repositories(username = get_current_git_username)

text: username string. git username list repositories

title: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
text: list current public repositories current git user

title: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
code: list_github_repositories("cran") #> GitHub repositories for user cran : #> -  https://github.com/cran/A3  #> -  https://github.com/cran/AalenJohansen  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aaMI  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aaSEA  #> -  https://github.com/cran/AATtools  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aba  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABACUS  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abasequence  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abbreviate  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abbyyR  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abc  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abc.data  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABC.RAP  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcADM  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCanalysis  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcdeFBA  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCExtremes  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abclass  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCoptim  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCp2  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcrf  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcrlda  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abctools  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abd  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abdiv  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abe  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abemus  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aberrance  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abess  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abf2  if (FALSE) { list_github_repositories() }

what: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: Function start backing files folder .bak. Make sure git initiated repository wish upload GitHub repository.

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
code: start_backup_prefs(   github_backup = FALSE,   copy_to_local = FALSE,   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences",   open_backup_path = FALSE,   git_message = "Backup of R Studio preferences on {Sys.Date()}",   repository = "." )

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: github_backup boolean. Upload file github. copy_to_local boolean. Copy .json files local TRUE. copy files repository folder specified. preference_path string. Path local backup folder open_backup_path boolean. Open default backup folder convenience TRUE. git_message string. git commit message. Default "Backup R Studio preferences Sys.Date()." repository string. Defaults current git repository. want upload another repository, specify path.

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: Backup rstudio_bindings.json, addins.json rstudio-bindings.json r.snippets .bak files native rstudioconfig folder. copy files working directory chosen file path executes git push github_backup = TRUE

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: Function wrapper using backup_prefs(). github_backup = TRUE, use functions: copy_files_to_local() upload_prefs_to_github()

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
code: # Copy files to the selected directory temp_dir <- tempdir() start_backup_prefs(copy_to_local = TRUE, preference_path = temp_dir) #> ✔ Preferences files copied to /tmp/Rtmp8aeI38 unlink(temp_dir)  if (FALSE) { # Backup prefs to the current git initiated repository start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE)  # Backup prefs to another local git repository that is not the current one, # matching one in the cloud start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE, repository = "../MyRStudioPrefs") }

what: Start the import process from Github by default or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
title: Start the import process from Github by default or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: Import preferences cloning link pulling GitHub. function start pull currently active GitHub repository, import local .json preference files. function look specific .json files , given file path. cloning chosen, folder inside working directory.

title: Start the import process from Github by default or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
code: start_import_prefs(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   pull_github = FALSE,   clone_git = FALSE,   git_url = NULL )

title: Start the import process from Github by default or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: preference_path string. Input file path preferences.json files located. pull_github boolean. Use TRUE pull clone GitHub, otherwise FALSE just import local files. clone_git boolean. Default FALSE. Clone git first time usage. convenience function avoid manually, essentially gert::git_clone("github_url"). clone repository inside current working directory. git_url string. Allows user bypass request git url directly clone desired git url repository working directory.

title: Start the import process from Github by default or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: Clone repository preference files copied RStudio's preference folder

title: Start the import process from Github by default or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: Function wrapper import_from_github() followed import_local_prefs()

title: Start the import process from Github by default or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
code: # To import your preferences from locally stored preferences files:  # Dummy preference files temp_dir <- tempdir() fs::file_create(file.path(temp_dir, "addins.json")) fs::file_create(file.path(temp_dir, "rstudio_bindings.json")) fs::file_create(file.path(temp_dir, "r.snippets")) fs::file_create(file.path(temp_dir, "rstudio-prefs.json")) start_import_prefs(pull_github = FALSE, preference_path = temp_dir) #> ✔ Sucessfully imported RStudio preferences. #> ✔ Files copied to /home/runner/.config/rstudio/keybindings #> ✔ Files copied to /home/runner/.config/rstudio.  # To import your preferences from Github: try(start_import_prefs()) #> Error in check_json_existence(preference_path) :  #>   No .json preference files are found. Please check the file path.

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
text: Add, commit push .json files automatically name

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
code: upload_prefs_to_github(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   git_message = "Backup of R Studio preferences on {Sys.Date()}.",   repository = "." )

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
text: preference_path string. Relative file path name git_message string. Enter git commit message. repository string. Defaults current git repository.

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
text: Upload .json files currently active git repository.

title: Upload preferences to GitHub — upload_prefs_to_github
code: # Setup oldwd <- getwd() repo <- file.path(tempdir(), "myrepo") gert::git_init(repo) setwd(repo)  # Upload preferences to currently active git repository upload_prefs_to_github("R/rstudio_preferences/") #> Error in upload_prefs_to_github("R/rstudio_preferences/"): Error: the preference path does not exist.  # Upload preferences to currently active git repository with a custom git commit message upload_prefs_to_github("R/rstudio_preferences/", git_message = "Backup preferences") #> Error in upload_prefs_to_github("R/rstudio_preferences/", git_message = "Backup preferences"): Error: the preference path does not exist.  # Cleanup setwd(oldwd) unlink(repo, recursive = TRUE)
